mixed-citation.article-title: Electrocambalidae fam. nov., a new family of Cambalidea from Cretaceous Burmese amber (Diplopoda, Spirostreptida)

tp:treatment-sec.p:
MYANMAR • 1 specimen ; Kachin State , Hukawng Valley , Mid-Cretaceous Burmese amber inclusion; in the collection of Patrick Müller ( BuB1115 )
.
MEASUREMENTS. 9.0 mm long, 0.3 mm in diameter.
AMBER DESCRIPTION. Rectangular, 14.2 × 5.3 × 2.5 mm . Polished, yellow, transparent.
SYNINCLUSIONS. Sporangia of fungi, pollen grains, plant parts.
TAPHONOMIC FEATURES. Laterally flattened. Head damaged on both sides, body rings partially damaged on left side. Muscles visible within legs. Amber with fissure along specimen.

This specimen is identified as a member of
Kachincambala
gen. nov. based on the absence of an accessory spine. The poor preservation of this specimen prevents any assignment to the species of
Kachincambala
described here or to describe it as a new species.
